item.title: Prayer vigil draws hundreds to Capitol Sunday night
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Adults and children stood quietly as seven pastors from around the metro took turns invoking God’s wisdom and guidance during a prayer vigil at Oklahoma’s State Capitol in Oklahoma City Sunday night. Candles came out as the last light of the day turned to darkness with the newly-lit south entry of the Capitol building as […]

The post Prayer vigil draws hundreds to Capitol Sunday night appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Teachers, supporters pack Capitol, plan to go back Wednesday
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Teachers, students, and parents packed the Capitol Tuesday panicking Legislators and staff and announced plans to return to the Capitol for a third day Wednesday. They will continue their demands on the Legislature to restore funding that has been stripped away over the last ten years. And even though the Legislature has passed several funding […]

The post Teachers, supporters pack Capitol, plan to go back Wednesday appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Six key quotes from the teacher walkout rally Monday
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Six quotes from the teacher walkout rally at the Oklahoma Capitol Monday revealed the realities that brought about the action that will continue on Tuesday. 1. Teachers have a hard time making a strike work. The purpose of a strike is disruption to achieve a goal. But, teachers care more for students than their own […]

item.title: Teacher walkout will test solidarity says AFT-OKC president
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
With the teacher walkout on for Monday, questions remain about the future: How long can teachers maintain their resolve if walkout days stretch into weeks? The president of the Oklahoma City American Federation of Teachers thinks the longer the walkout lasts, the harder it will be for teachers to maintain their resolve in large enough […]

The post Teacher walkout will test solidarity says AFT-OKC president appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: OKCPS emails parents about plans for teacher walkout
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The Oklahoma City Public Schools administration sent emails Wednesday night to parents of the 46,000 students about how they will support fully support a teacher walkout and care for students. The Board of Education approved a resolution March 5 to support a teacher walkout over school funding if one occurred. The parent communication, now up […]

The post OKCPS emails parents about plans for teacher walkout appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: OKCPS principals union supports canceling classes for teacher walkout
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The principals union in Oklahoma City Public Schools has taken a public stand for a teacher “job action, in the form of canceling classes” to bring pressure on the Oklahoma Legislature. Greg Frederick, principal at U.S. Grant High School is also the president of Local 79 of the American Federation of School Administrators – Oklahoma […]

The post OKCPS principals union supports canceling classes for teacher walkout appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: OKCPS Board supports teacher walkout, approves teacher contracts
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
In a unanimous vote, the Oklahoma City Public Schools Board of Education passed a resolution Monday supporting the possibility of a teacher walkout over state education funding. Board members and parents expressed concern about new plans underway to expand the number of split-grade classrooms from the current 18 to 57 next year. (Watch for our […]

The post OKCPS Board supports teacher walkout, approves teacher contracts appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.
